node.title: 'We're going to take you to see your mummy and daddy': Heartwarming video of moment Cleo is rescued released by police
node.alt: A male police officer speaks to a young girl in the arms of another male police officer
node.description: Police release a heart-warming video of the moment officers rescued four-year-old Cleo Smith, who had been missing for 18 days.
node.content: ["Police have released video\u00a0of the moment Cleo Smith was rescued from a house in Carnarvon, 18 days after she vanished while on a family camping trip.", "In the 11-second video, Cleo can be seen with\u00a0a\u00a0police officer, who is carrying her outside, while\u00a0Detective Senior Sergeant Cameron Blaine talks to her.", "\"Cleo, my name's Cameron, are you OK?\" Detective Blaine gently asks the four-year-old.", "Her arms firmly around the officer, Cleo nods her head.", "\"We're going to take you to see your mummy and daddy, is that good?\"", "Smiling as she plays with the hood on the officer's jacket, Cleo nods again.", "Cleo was found alone in the house after officers forced their way inside at 12:46am on Wednesday.", "Her sudden disappearance\u00a0from the family's tent at the remote Blowholes camping site, 75 kilometres north of Carnarvon and almost 1,000 kilometres from Perth, sparked one of the biggest police investigations in Western Australia's history.", "More than 100 officers trawled for evidence at the scene, while others investigated the thousands of pieces of information obtained through phone records, rubbish bins and appeals for public help.", "Police today said new information received late on Tuesday led them to the locked\u00a0 house, where Cleo was found alone in a bedroom.", "A 36-year-old man is in police custody, but no charges have yet been laid."]
